title: 108_hr482
content:
The "Florida National Forest Land Management Act of 2003" defines terms like "Secretary" as the Secretary of Agriculture and "State" as the State of Florida. It also addresses the sale or exchange of land. The Secretary has the authority to sell or exchange US interests in Federal land in Florida, specifically parcels in Santa Rosa County. This includes tract A-942a (61 acres) and tract A-942b (40 acres). (2) Tract A-942b in East Bay, Santa Rosa County, is approximately 40 acres in T. 1 S., R. 27 W., sec. 38; (3) Tract A-942c in Ft. Walton, Okaloosa County, is about 0.59 acres in T. 1 S., R. 24 W., sec. 26; (4) Tract A-942d southeast of Crestview, Okaloosa County, is roughly 79.90 acres in T. 2 N., R. 23 W., sec. 2, NW1/4 NE1/4 and NE1/4 NW1/4. Tract A-942d southeast of Crestview, Okaloosa County, is approximately 79.90 acres in T. 2 N., R. 23 W., sec. 2, NW1/4 NE1/4 and NE1/4 NW1/4; tract A-943, Okaloosa County Fairgrounds, Ft. Walton, Okaloosa County, is about 30.14 acres in T. 1 S., R. 24 W., sec. 26, S1/2; tract A-944, City Ball Park--Ft. Walton, Okaloosa County, is roughly 12.43 acres in T. 1 S., R. 24 W., sec. 26, S1/2; tract A-945, Landfill-Golf Course Driving Range, located southeast of Crestview, Okaloosa County. Tract A-945 is a 40.85-acre Landfill-Golf Course Driving Range in Okaloosa County. Tract A-959 consists of 2 vacant lots on Micheaux Road in Liberty County, covering 0.5 acres. Tract C-3m-d is a 15.0-acre property southwest of Astor in Lake County. (9) Tract C-3m-d is a 15.0-acre property in Lake County, located southwest of Astor. 
(10) Tract C-691 in Lake County includes the subsurface rights to approximately 40.76 acres of land. 
(11) Tract C-2208b in Lake County covers about 39.99 acres. 
(12) Tract C-2209 in Lake County consists of approximately 127.2 acres. Tracts C-2209, C-2209b, C-2209c, and C-2209d in Lake County consist of approximately 127.2 acres, 39.41 acres, 40.09 acres, and an unspecified acreage respectively. Tract C-2210 in Marion County consists of approximately 30 acres on Lake Kerr, described as government lot 1 with 20 recreational residential lots. Tract C-2213 in Marion County is located in the F.M. Arrendondo grant East of Ocala. Tract C-2213 in Marion County, part of the F.M. Arrendondo grant, includes approximately 15.0 acres east of State Highway 19. The Secretary can modify land descriptions for sale or exchange based on a survey. The Secretary can modify land descriptions for sale or exchange based on a survey or determination in the best interest of the public. The Secretary may solicit offers for the sale or exchange of land and reject offers if deemed necessary. The Secretary has the authority to reject offers for land sale if they are deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. The land can be sold publicly or privately, including at auction, with terms determined by the Secretary. Real estate brokers can be used in the sale or exchange, with commissions paid as necessary. The Secretary may use a real estate broker to sell land and pay them a commission comparable to local rates. The Secretary of the Air Force must approve the sale or exchange of certain parcels of land. Cash equalization rules apply when exchanging Federal land for non-Federal land. The Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 allows the Secretary to accept a cash equalization payment exceeding 25% of the value of Federal land exchanged. Proceeds from any sale or exchange under this Act are deposited in the Sisk Act fund for the Secretary's discretionary use. The Sisk Act allows the Secretary to use deposited funds for land acquisition and reimbursement of costs related to land sales and exchanges. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATION. Land acquired by the United States under this Act shall be subject to the Weeks Act and administered according to National Forest System laws. The described land is not subject to the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949 and is withdrawn from public land, mining, and mineral leasing laws. The described land is withdrawn from location, entry, and patent under public land, mining, and mineral leasing laws.
